result.execSummary:
The defendant John W. Aguilera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
a) keep DA inform address/phone # chg
b) no criminal activity
c) comply/complete terms prob
d) pst $607.95 w/in 30 mos
e) 40 hrs community service
f) pay all other financial
g) comply w/cond's of bond

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted credit for time served as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department
AMENDED 9/25/19- 443 days credit
Concurrent with: Count 2

superMiscConds.notes:
The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.
  The Def is to obtain treatment as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def. Complete Sex Offender treatment.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are sold or consumed, which includes but not limited to: house parties, bars, taverns, casino....
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
NO CONTACT WITH L.J.S. 1/29/99

  The Def is to comply with the Sex Offender Registry Program as required by Ch. 301!
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

supervisions.notes:
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

Concurrent with: Count 2

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
Added to current pymt plan.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Defendant, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol - no house parties & no Casino) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed!
  The Defendant is subject to random UA testing.
Def to have NO contact w/LJS (dob 1/29/99).
  The Defendant is to comply with the Sex Offender Registry Program.
Def obt psycho-sexual perpetrator assessment & follow thru w/all recommendations.
  The Defendant is to provide a DNA specimen.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.
